author: D. Bansal
text:
'Update 10/09:

Service has drastically gone downhill

Original:
Would give more stars if I could. Food and service is excellent. The cacio e Pepe is recommended.'

author: Kirsten Walpert
text: 'Good food
column5: terrible service.  Felt pushed out the door from the moment we sat down.  Appetizers served at the same time as mains.  Several servers were rude and made comments about us leaving throughout the meal.'

author: Michael Oake
text: 'BOTTOM LINE: Review your Bill.\n\nThis 2 star rating is strictly based off of some food being good. The pasta was well done
column5:
the eggplant burrata honestly was delicious. You get the gist.

I‚Äôve never experienced more insulting ownership in my life. Enough for me to sit here and write this review.

Our waitress was new
column6: the risotto was never fired
column8: and the steak was drastically over cooked.  None of this is why I‚Äôm here.  Our check came and the bill was 12 dollars higher than expected. Our 7 waters cost 14 dollars (the menu said 1 dollar each). The steak cost 44 dollars (39 on the menu). This issue was quickly elevated to management since it was our waitresses second day. When the owner came
column9: I pointed out the discrepancy and he stated that meat costs have increased. I recommended he change his menu prices because my expectation was to pay X. Longer story still long
column10: it ended when the owner stated ‚Äúpay what you want‚Äù ‚Äúdo you go food shopping?‚Äù ‚Äúit costs hundreds of dollars to change my menu‚Äù ‚Äúthere‚Äôs a lot of things I should do‚Äù.\n\nBottom Line: Review your Bill'

author: Jack Ferreira
text: 'Been here on a couple occasions and the food never disappoints.  Gio is a superstar and Iggy the owner is a stand up guy.  Their wood fire pizza is super thin and very crunch.  I always leave there thinking about when will be the next time I have the pizza.'

author: Joseph Peterson
text: 'Beautiful place. Great wait staff. The owner (Iggy) made us feel at home. Food is out of this world.'

author: Christopher Dunne
text: "Ordered through the Panello website (links to Slice).  Pizza was cold and missing mozzarella
column5: so I returned 10mins later thinking they would make this right.  Instead shop said the menu on the website must be wrong and didn't know why the pizza would be cold.  0/5 for customer service but 1/5 for the cold pizza I'm eating."

author: Jace Graham
text: 'Great pizza
column5: great service
column6: fast'

author: bruce baxter
text: 'Great food
column5: The white pizza was amazing. Rigatoni Bolognaise was very good. BYOB makes the place even better.  We got there early and didnt understand why with food so good that the place was empty. By the time we left the place was full. And people waiting to get in'

author: Ricardo Llera
text: 'Terrible service by Iggy the owner and the waiters. We were there along with some other families with kids for a nice dinner when suddenly we got verbally attacked by a client who was drunk and high on weed with his friends demanding all of us to take our kids away. What did the owner do at this point? Absolutely nothing! No apologies
column5: no accountability whatsoever for having to put with this idiot
column6: or even offered a discount. They should close this place down if they allow clients who can‚Äôt handle being around families! And on top of it all service was slow and the food was bad üëéüèºüëéüèº'

author: Gilda Llera
text: 'We are regulars and always loved this place until today
column5: we got verbally ASSAULTED by a customer and Iggy (owner) did nothing no apology nothing
column6: we were amongst 4 tables that got verbally abused by a customer in the outdoors area while enjoying our meal
column7: Owner tried to calm down THAT client but didn‚Äôt apologize to the rest. Guy was smoking weed and drinking
column8: complaining about why are kids even there? Excuse me? Walking up to tables threatening customers saying he wanted to enjoy a nice night as adult with no kids? So maybe don‚Äôt go to the restaurant that has not one but two daycares next door and is in the middle of a cultural center for kids? Inexcusable and poor response from the owner all of the affected families are local residents from buildings in and around Monroe
column9: won‚Äôt be going there won‚Äôt be booking special occasions there and we are disappointed.'

author: Hande Kursav
text: 'Best sour dough pizza in Hoboken!'

author: Redouan Nhili
text: 'food is good
column5: location is nice with a great outdoor set up. I actually used to go almost every week with family
column6: but it does not seems to be often enough to get decent service. Waiters are rude
column7: too busy and give a real bad vibes. You feel like you are bothering them.'

author: Natalya Kokhanovska
text: 'If there was a 0 star this place would of gotten it! They have no customer integrity when it comes to pickup. I‚Äôve place an order at 9:35pm on Slice my order said it would be ready at 10:10pm
column5: when I walked to the place at 10:10 it was closed! No one even bothered calling me to notify that they were closing or if they can‚Äôt make the order. The next stay I called to receive a refund
column6: they claimed that they still have the food for me to come pick it up almost 24 hours later! The manger was really rude and screaming that I wasn‚Äôt going to receive a refund. This place should be closed just for safety violation serving food over 24 hours. He legitimately stated to pickup my food from the previous night and it was already 8:23PM next day.\n\nNever ordering from them again!'

author: Jason Pasculli
text: 'The absolute worst !!!   I‚Äôll never go back there ever!! Stay far away'

author: Gene Rabinovich
text: 'You‚Äôll find simple yet delightful selection of traditional Italian fare at this pizza restaurant located in Monroe Center for the Arts. We have dined here with friends a few times now and each time walked away impressed and mentally noting the menu items we should try the next time we visit. The place is kids‚Äô favorite
column5: too
column6: as they can always count on getting thin crust Nutella pizza here. You are always welcome to bring your own bottle of wine to enjoy with your meal. And if you didn‚Äôt bring one from home there is a nice wine store literally next door.'

author: Veronica Mijares
text: 'Best pizza and meatball in New Jersey!üòã'

author: rob gilbert
text: 'Horrible food. Got abused by a guy named Stephan after complaining. Will never set a foot in there again.'

author: Robyn S
text: "Worst pizza in the world. Chef doesn't wear hairnet and I found two hairs in my pizza. After I complained to the owner Stephen I was abused and told it was myn even though my hair is blonde and this was clearly from someone with black hair. Don't eat there !"

author: Kelly Phelan
text: 'Great experience. The pizza is authentic brick oven and the apps/entrees never disappoint. BYOB and quick service.'

author: Evan Gemma
text: 'Amazing quality ! Never had a bad meal and eat there 3 times a week. The owner is the nicest guy and is there every night ensuring you an amazing experience!'

author: Pete
text: "Pretty good place. The folks were friendly and I enjoyed my dish ... but my wife wasn't as impressed with her food so you guys only get 4 stars."

author: Patrick Layde
text: 'The staff are great. So nice
column5: very welcoming and the atmosphere is great. We tried a few of the specials and they were delicious! Can‚Äôt go wrong with BYOB. We‚Äôll definitely be back.'

author: Abhijith Reddy
text: "Decent food. Bad service. Staff has a very tough time handling orders during peak hours. Multiple times I Had to wait longer than 45 mins for pizza. Don't order through slice or google maps
column5: they'll lose your order."

author: Maryann Lovese
text: 'Thin crust
column5: delicious taste
column6: one of
column8: the best pizza restaurants I have ever been to.'

author: Hasan Cimentepe
text: 'Original pizza
column5: worth to change your way to try'

author: angel martinez
text: 'I was there last Friday 10/02/2020. Everything was perfect from the service
column5: time to get food served and the delicious
column6: homemade taste of the food. I would give them 10 stars. I will come back to this place and i recommend to visit Panello.'

author: Luca De Simone
text: 'Very nice outdoor setting in open space tents. Good service and great Neapolitan style pizza. They have both personal and larger pizze. I tried the Marinara
column5: the typical pizza without cheese
column6: and the Margherita. They were both excellent. They have a wood fired oven. Good meatballs. BYOB.'

author: Catalina Aristizabal Betancourt
text: '(Translated by Google) It is lousy
column5: they are extremely rude and of very poor quality they do not provide any kind of attention
column6: please never come to eat at this place
column8: son extremadamente groseros y de muy mala calidad no brindan ning√∫n tipo de atenci√≥n
column9: por favor nunca vengan a comer a este sitio

author: Andres Arroyave
text:
'(Translated by Google) Bad attention

(Original)
Mala atenci√≥n'

author: Amir Zeenreich
text:
"Smallest portions ever!!!
Kids pasta is maybe 20 pieces of penne (9$!!) and smallest large pizza in Hoboken (21$!)

Their pizza is good though
column5:
I'll give them that!
The pasta was below average and the sauce was barely felt and lacked seasoning

Go eat someplace else
column6: you get a better bang for your buck for a similar quality"

author: Sophia T
text: 'Great margarita pizzas
column5: Nutella pizzas
column6: and focaccia. However I‚Äôve seen servers walking around without masks
column7: specifically the older white haired chef/waiter.'

author: John Norelli
text: 'Amazing wood fired pizza.  BYOB and limited beverage selection. Other foods were very good as well.'

author: Andy Y
text: "Amazing food
column5: and even better service! My wife and I reached out to multiple restaurants about hosting a small post-wedding dinner just as Hoboken was opening up for outdoor dining. While most restaurants either wouldn't return our calls or weren't willing/able to think through the logistics of such a reservation (within the city's guidelines
column6: of course)
column7: Frieda at Panello was incredibly accommodating. She went above and beyond to work with us in this time of uncertainty and gave us the perfect dinner to cap off an incredible day.\n\nIn addition to their thoughtfulness
column8: the food was fantastic! We started with a custom antipasto platter
column9: shrimp skewers and baked artichokes. For our entre
column10: we ordered an assortment of Pizzas (#CovidWedding) and the Penne Vodka to share. All the food was amazing
column11: but I kid you not: the Truffle pizza was one of the best pizzas I've ever had. We'll be back for that alone

author: Valery Bentzianov
text: 'Amazing Italian food
column5: without the usual ‚ÄúItalian restaurant‚Äù flaws. Best Italian restaurant in Hoboken.'

author: Susan Francese
text: 'Panello was a wonderful restaurant and venue for a recent baby shower that we held at the restaurant on a Saturday afternoon. All the planning went extremely smoothly  and the decorations looked beautiful in the space.  We had 35 people and the salad
column5: pizza
column6: and penne √† la vodka that we ordered was beyond delicious.  The restaurant catered to special diet restrictions in a seamless manner.  The restaurant served perfect cappuccinos and espressos with our homemade desserts. Frieda and her staff were wonderful to us by welcoming us into their restaurant and providing us with excellent food and service. Thank you again!'

author: Mayson Eaton
text: 'This site is my favorite place.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to this restaurant. everytime  I I need a superb supper
column5: this is the place that comes immediately to my mind. excellent and diverse  food and a large menu.great team
column6: and pleasant atmosphere. Also
column7: the bill is fair. I praise this spot with pleasure.'

author: Barbara Crump
text: 'Food was great and staff friendly'

author: anzar zaidi
text: 'I attended a birthday party at Panello
column5: their Pizzas are amazing and the people who run this place are even better!'

author: Derek Soltis
text: 'The food is amazing.'

author: Nick Zubrycki
text: 'Amazing food. Favorite place to eat in Hoboken. Great service.'

author: Joseph Keenan
text: 'Pizza was very greasy and service is ok at best
column5: there are better places in Hoboken / Jersey City.'

author: varvara kirylchyk
text: 'Relaxing atmosphere
column5: tasty Buratto pizza üëçüèº'

author: Judy Hsiung
text: 'I came here with friends
column5: octopus dish and kale abrian (pizza) were our favorite dishes. Wish I took pictures of it. Would definitely come back for kale abrian!'

author: Punit Shah
text: 'Phenomenal pizza in a neighborhood filled with "NY style" pizza joiny that show the true nature of the bougie neighborhood they\'re in.\n\nTruffle pizza was üëåüèº
column5: fluffy and light crust baked just right. Pasta red sauce was really good
column6: with fennel(?) gave it a unique flavor. Will be back again
column7: next time with a malbec to pair with'

author: SCH
text: 'Food was fantastic but the service was poor.  Waiters were not too happy to be working and made it clear they were working for the tips and could care less about the customers.   The atmosphere was poor too.  The inside seating was extremely loud and the outside had kids everywhere.  I would try it again due to the quality of the food. 5 stars for the chef zero for the rest!!'

author: Panos Ioannou
text:
'The gold standard of wood fired oven pizza.
Ridiculously delicious creative hand crafted recipes are to die for.
Pasta and appetizers were also out of this world.
Could eat here every night.'

author: Monica Rosenfeld
text: 'The owner and the staff are very friendly and easy to speak with about their menu
column5: which is a bit limited and the food is ok.'

author: Carmine Giorella
text: 'Delicious Wood Fire Oven Pizza!!'

author: STeven J
text: 'Some hard working folks make your visit special'

author: Joe Villani
text: 'The pizza is absolutely divine. The high prices are expected for the area and the quality.'

author: Joel Sidwell
text: "This place had tasty brick oven pizzas with unique toppings. Be warned
column5: this is in a very residential area and there were several families with kids
column6: so if you're looking for a quiet spot it might not fit the bill. The service was good and the space seemed clean and well-maintained."

author: Lawrence Schena
text: 'Excellent pizza. BYOB'

author: Karoline M.
text: 'Mhh
column5: my favorite pizza place
column6: with thin artisanal pizzas fresh out of the wood fired oven. The Pizza Speck is so delicious with sweet & spicy onion chutney
column7: balanced by salty prosciutto and creamy cheese.\nBonus points for being kid friendly

author: Ma Nithyananda Sevika
text: 'Authentic Italian fare with wonderful aromas of fresh Parmesan and rich sauces greet you at the door. The warmth of the oven and buttered bread make for a great start to a wonderful and varied menu selection. I highly recommend the meatballs and beet salad.'

author: Valentina J
text: 'Great pizza and they have a vegan option!'

author: Q
text: 'Their pizza is the best.  Pasta tastes ok.  BYOB and a wine shop is two doors down.  Definitely coming back.'

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: 'The food was slightly above the quality of your typical fancy Italian restaurant
column5: but for me
column6: not quite high enough to warrant 5 stars. I will
column8: give a special nod to the service. They were incredibly fast bringing out our food
column9: and were very diligent the rest of the night in keeping us satisfied. This is a very solid four stars.'

author: Frank Ng
text: "Panello is the perfect type of place to bring a bottle of wine (or 3) and enjoy some conversation with your friends while the restaurant takes care of you.  It's casual and off the beaten path so you won't feel hurried. The food they serve fits this vibe perfectly. It's non-pretentious food in decent portions and cooked to perfection.  We'll be dining here frequently."

author: Ken Boyar
text: 'I want to like this place but the food has been too hit/ miss. The pizzas are very good
column5: the pastas so-so. I ordered a bolognese that arrived in one massive sticky lump with all of the strands stuck together. And even when the food is right
column6: and it can be really good
column7: the service is nearly always less than good. I get the distinct feeling that they hire wait staff with little to no restaurant experience.'

author: Amy Cheng
text: 'Delicious Italian food! Small place
column5: but solid food. BYOB. A bit pricey per pizza and dish but worth it for the splurge for our rare occasion of going out. üòã Would come back again for special occasions.'

author: Ashley Bernero
text: 'Their marinara pizza is my favorite pizza in all of Hoboken and the other menu items are fantastic as well. It‚Äôs a cozy place to enjoy with friends or family.'

author: Steven Fink
text: "Since the day they opened we have been weekly customers. I look forward to this meal every week and to see the friendly
column5: warm faces on their staff. The food is excellent and made to your liking. Iggy and Frieda know what they're doing. Get to know them and your experience will be even greater. Panello is the little miracle of northwest Hoboken."

author: Peter Chu
text: 'Service was mediocre on a Sunday for dinner'

author: Walter Zielenski
text: "Poor service
column5: slow food
column6: overly-child-friendly atmosphere.\n\nUnderstandably
column7: the amount of children running around was not their fault. It looked like the restaurant was beneath an elementary school and surrounded by tutoring companies. It seemed to be the convenient
column8: go-to place for families with their screaming kids. It absolutely distracted from the atmosphere
column10: and I have no complaints with it at all; well cooked cacio e pepe and a beautiful pizza. It's a shame that it came out after an hour wait. We had two waiters swapping back and forth; figuring out who was in charge of our table was a task
column11: and I'm still not sure who it was
column13: both would disappear for large gaps of time without coming remotely near our table again.\n\nI wouldn't recommend this place

author: Karsten Niehues
text: 'Really great food.'

author: Patty Bourdett
text: "Love this restaurant.  Held a bridal shower
column5: & it couldn't be more perfect.  Food was Amazing
column6: and staff when far & above to help me coordinate my event!!!  Highly recommend this place!!  I will definitely go back for dinner

author: Tawna Michel Dabney
text: 'The pasta was AMAZING & the service fabulous as well!!!'

author: Fabio Almeida
text: 'The food is OK but the pizza was overcooked and the pasta lacked flavor. The service was excellent.'

author: Joe Alvaro
text: 'Secretly the best pizza in town'

author: Anna Bator
text: 'Excellent food! Staff was very friendly.'

author: Ben Langford
text: 'Best gnocchi of my life.'

author: Kyle Matson
text: 'Great pizza spot!! Brick oven and with delicious crust'

author: Ximena Galvan
text: 'Delicioso penne in vodka sauce I love it
column5: and to finish the night I went to ArteVino with my friends. The place very nice and a great outside place my friends and I love it.'

author: Bill Sr
text: 'Good pizza and pasta.'

author: Carlo Maguire
text: 'I went here for a graduation party. It was very nice
column5: wonderful food
column6: great outdoor space and overall a good experience. Would recommend.'

author: NYC FITS
text: 'This is what real pizza tastes like!'

author: Marco Navarra
text: "Would be 5 stars if they took reservations and I like table cloth type service. Veronica
column5: our server was great and spot on with her suggestions! Awesome apps of meatballs
column6: olives
column8: followed by Finocheilla pizza. Tasty octopus app too. Cacio e Pepe was very authentic. If you don't know Cacio E Pepe
column9: then you won't appreciate the restaurant just like the other reviewers. BYOB and we will be back!!!"

author: Amer A
text: 'Great pizza. Nice outside seating area.'

author: Christina Masiello
text: 'Nice but the bathroom was broken and we had a go into the building next door. The food and the service was excellent.\n.'

author: Steve Markarian
text: 'Best pizza in hoboken....DONE'

author: Aniesha Jones
text: 'Great atmosphere and even better food!!!'

author: Shantanu Rastogi
text: 'Nice Italian food - pastas are made to order'

author: Abhishek Gupta
text: 'Food is good
column5: service is barely acceptable. We went at 5:25 p.m. on a Saturday evening (5 minutes before they open). While they had large groups that were expected at 6 / 6:30 p.m.
column6: the service attitude was definitely like we are doing you a favor by serving you food. I know things can get busy but at least serve with a smile. 0'

author: Michael Urbano
text: 'Love their food! Great little restaurant and the staff is very hospitable!'

author: Ayushi
text: 'Not for vegetarians üòÖ'

author: Pina Bonamici
text: 'I came here for a first birthday party. The staff was very sweet and the pizza and pasta were amazing and delicious. I definitely will be back.'

author: Allie Gazda
text: 'Good pizza
column5: BYOB. Our waiter forgot about us for a while.'

author: Master Sage
text: 'Great place love it'

author: Felix Garcia
text: 'Excellent'

author: Victor Manuel Gonzalez
text: '(Translated by Google) Excellent place
column5: great food
column6: excellent service and you can bring your own drink
column7:
what more can you ask for.

(Original)
Excelente lugar
column9: inmejorable atenciones y puedes traer t√∫ propia bebida

author: Manof Wood
text: 'Great service
column5: authentic Italian food
column6: a bit of the beaten path in Hoboken. No cover charge for NYE.'

author: Paddu Kapadia
text: 'Good food

author: Ciro Wirz
text:
"(Translated by Google) Panello the best bread in America.
Ignazio and Frida lovely people

(Original)
Panello il pane pi√π buono d'America.
Ignazio e Frida persone adorabili"

author: Abe Kasbo
text: 'Amazing!'

author: Danilo Morales
text: 'Great place!! Beautiful decor and awesome food!!!'

author: Agan Singh
text: 'The pizzas were my favorite part of dinner. They also had a mushroom quesadilla that was a special that was great. I highly recommend the Nutella pizza for dessert. Hopefully you get Doug as your server. He was fantastic'

author: Gregory Visconti
text: 'Great Authentic Italian Food in an authentic rustic urban settung'

author: Hank Schrader
text: 'One of the worst experiences of my life
column5: there was a bug in my margherita pizza.'

author: Dan F
text: 'Fantastic food all around. I have been going here for some time now and I am never disappointed. Everyone I take here always want to come back again. The service is also fantastic
column5: all of the wait staff are friendly and create an overall great atmosphere.'

author: Virginia Tinsley
text: "Firstly
column5: the pizzas are tiny and overpriced. And they're very average. But the worst part - there was a BUG in the salad! Absolutely disgusting. Will never go back."

author: Fluffy Panda
text: 'Delicious squid ink puttanesca and thin crust fresh pizzas! Loved it! Beautiful decor too'

author: Ashley Lanza
text: "I have lived in the area for five years and have tried just about every Italian restaurant in the area. Tonight I did dinner here with some friends based off of several recommendations and I am very happy I found this place. I had the burrata appetizer and the bolognese lasagna
column5: both of which I highly recommend. Everyone at our table agreed that the food was so fresh and perfectly cooked. For dessert we had the Nutella pie which was out of this world. The service was excellent
column6: its BYOB
column7: and the owner and chef came to our table and introduced himself. It really doesn't get better than that. Will definitely be back."

author: Chris Rupert
text: 'Great thing crust pizza with excellent choices for toppings. A little noisy
column5: service was exceptional.'

author: Damian De Virgilio
text: 'Near the top of my list of local pizza spots.'

author: David Silver
text: 'Nice Wait Staff\nGood Food\nGood Service'

author: Daniel L
text: "Great neighborhood spot. It's BYO so hit the Cheese + Wine site next door beforehand."

author: Dustin Glass
text: 'Top notch wood-fired pizza to eat-in/take-out.  If you are looking for fast takeout
column5: a pizza is ready for pick-up in about 7-10 minutes. Much better than Dozzino and the kitchen staff is very accommodating (unlike at Dozzino).'

author: Jean Baptiste Allard
text: 'Poor Service
column5: not kid friendly'

author: Gator Neil
text: "Ok
column5: this place is the real deal.  Incredible wood fired pizzas of the most creative motif
column6: excellent meatballs
column7: the melanzane appetizer unlike anything I've tasted. The desserts were every bit as good and the espresso devine. Run

author: David Thompson
text: 'Great food
column5: service
column6: atmosphere. BYOB too!'

author: Danielle Doyle
text: 'Best margarita pie ever.  Creative menu. Owners are very nice'

author: Richard maggio
text: 'The best wood fired oven pizza in Hudson County'

author: Alex Keichinger
text: 'Great place Excellent pizza. One of the best BYOB places in Hoboken'
